comment._content: All ancient civilizations seem to have a common theme in architecture.

comment.author: 27398485@N08
comment._content:
Yes, they do, a recent excavation in Chile exemplifies the trend toward mountains as buildings...  (want to call it Coral...) A new found civilization with pyramidal temples, and no sign of war - a vast city based on trade.  No one explored the area always thinking those were natural hills....believe it was discovered in 1998.....thousands of years old - there are those wondering if this was the Southern hemisphere mother city...

Where there is building - Humans saw mountains, and said: "I think we can do that...with a little bit 'o' style!"

comment._content: The museum at Sakkara has a wonderful exhibit on the archeologist who did some early work on the step pyramid, and how the architecture is derived from natural forms. It is amazing to see these 100 year old photographs, and to realize that the scene today is not all that different, really.
